components.description:
A rooster (cock), a male chicken known for its cock-a-doodle-do. Depicted as a white or multicolored rooster standing on its legs in full profile facing left, with a red comb on its head and red wattle on its neck.

Not to be confused with üêî Chicken, though their applications overlap. See also üê£ Hatching Chick, üê§ Baby Chick, and üê• Front-Facing Baby Chick. Occasionally used as sexual slang.

One of the 12 animals of the Chinese zodiac.

Google’s rooster is brown with a green tail, Facebook’s brown with a blue tail. Google’s rooster was previously white, Microsoft’s yellow, Samsung’s looking straight ahead.
components.title: Rooster

Not to be confused with üêî Chicken, though their applications overlap. See also üê£ Hatching Chick, üê§ Baby Chick, and üê• Front-Facing Baby Chick. Occasionally used as sexual slang.

title: Rooster

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A rooster; a male chicken known also as a cockerel or cock. Rooster was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 20 http://emojipedia.org/rooster/
emoji_net_data.name: rooster

bn:13728278v: To avoid as a result of fear.

bn:00020266n: A male chicken (Gallus gallus domesticus), a domestic bird.
A male of any species of gallinaceous bird. Typically refers to the domestic chicken, .
A rooster also known as a cockerel or cock is a male gallinaceous bird, usually a male chicken.
A male chicken or other gallinaceous bird.

bn:00018265n: Domesticated fowl, primarily a source of food
The flesh of a chicken used for food
The flesh of the domesticated chicken (Gallus gallus domesticus).
The chicken is a domesticated fowl, a subspecies of the Red Junglefowl.
Chickens are a domesticated fowl, a subspecies of the Red Junglefowl.
A hen; a cooked chicken; a chicken dressed for cooking.
A domestic fowl, Gallus gallus, especially when young

bn:00028155n: Fowl are birds belonging to one of two biological orders, namely the gamefowl or landfowl and the waterfowl.
A domesticated gallinaceous bird thought to be descended from the red jungle fowl
A bird that is kept for its meat and eggs.
The meat from a domestic fowl
Poultry are domesticated birds kept by humans for the eggs they produce, their meat, their feathers, or sometimes as pets.
Domesticated fowl grown for their meat and eggs.
